tests.name: simple range loop
tests.template: {% for i in (0..3) %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: range loop using identifier
tests.template: {% for i in (0..product.end_range) %}{{ i }} - {{ product.tags[i] }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: simple array loop
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ tag }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over an array in reverse
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags reversed %}{{ tag }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: simple hash loop
tests.template: {% for c in collection %}{{ c[0] }} {{ c[1] }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: empty array with default
tests.template: {% for img in emptythings.array %}{{ img.url }} {% else %}no images{% endfor %}

tests.name: break
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{% if tag == 'sports' %}{% break %}{% else %}{{ tag }} {% endif %}{% else %}no images{% endfor %}

tests.name: continue
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{% if tag == 'sports' %}{% continue %}{% else %}{{ tag }} {% endif %}{% else %}no images{% endfor %}

tests.name: limit
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags limit:1 %}{{ tag }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags offset:1 %}{{ tag }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop length
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.length }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop length with limit
tests.template: {% for tag in tags limit:3 %}{{ forloop.length }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop length with offset
tests.template: {% for tag in tags offset:3 %}{{ forloop.length }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop goes out of scope
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.length }} {% endfor %}{{ forloop.length }}

tests.name: forloop.first
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.first }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop.last
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.last }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop.index
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.index }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop.index0
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.index0 }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop.rindex
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.rindex }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop.rindex0
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.rindex0 }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop name
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags limit:1 %}{{ forloop.name }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop name of a range
tests.template: {% for i in (1..3) limit:1 %}{{ forloop.name }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: forloop no such attribute
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ forloop.nosuchthing }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: iterate an empty array
tests.template: {% for item in emptythings.array %}{{ item }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: iterate an empty array with default
tests.template: {% for item in emptythings.array %}{{ item }}{% else %}foo{% endfor %}

tests.name: lookup a filter from an outer context
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{{ tag | upcase }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: assign inside loop
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags %}{% assign x = tag %}{% endfor %}{{ x }}

tests.name: blank empty loops
tests.template: {% for i in (0..10) %}  {% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over nested and chained object from context with trailing identifier
tests.template: {% for link in linklists[section.settings.menu].links %}{{ link }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over undefined
tests.template: {% for tag in nosuchthing %}{{ tag }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: continue a loop
tests.template: {% for item in array limit: 3 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in array offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 a3 b4 b5 b6

tests.name: continue a loop over an assigned range
tests.template: {% assign nums = (1..5) %}{% for item in nums limit: 3 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in nums offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: continue a loop over a changing array
tests.template: {% assign foo = '1,2,3,4,5,6' | split: ',' %}{% for item in foo limit: 3 %}{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% assign foo = 'u,v,w,x,y,z' | split: ',' %}{% for item in foo offset: continue %}{{ item }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: continue with changing loop var
tests.template: {% for foo in array limit: 3 %}{{ foo }} {% endfor %}{% for bar in array offset: continue %}{{ bar }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: nothing to continue from
tests.template: {% for item in array %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in array offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 a3 a4 a5 a6

tests.name: offset continue without preceding loop
tests.template: {% for item in array offset: continue %}{{ item }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: continue from a limit that is greater than length
tests.template: {% for item in array limit: 99 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in array offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 a3 a4 a5 a6

tests.name: continue from a range expression
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 3 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 a3 b4 b5 b6

tests.name: offset continue twice with limit
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 2 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) limit: 2 offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}c{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 b3 b4 c5 c6

tests.name: offset continue twice with changing limit
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 2 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) limit: 3 offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}c{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 b3 b4 b5 c6

tests.name: offset continue twice with no second limit
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 2 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}c{{ item }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: a1 a2 b3 b4 b5 b6

tests.name: offset continue from a broken loop
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 4 %}{% if item == 3 %}{% break %}{% endif %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset continue from a broken loop with preceding limit
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 3 %}a{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) %}{% if item == 3 %}{% break %}{% endif %}b{{ item }} {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}c{{ item }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset continue forloop length
tests.template: {% for item in (1..6) limit: 2 %}a{{ item }} - {{ forloop.length }}, {% endfor %}{% for item in (1..6) offset: continue %}b{{ item }} - {{ forloop.length }}, {% endfor %}

tests.name: parentloop is normally undefined
tests.template: {% for i in (1..2)%}{{ forloop.parentloop.index }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: access parentloop
tests.template: {% for i in (1..2)%}{% for j in (1..2) %}{{ i }} {{j}} {{ forloop.parentloop.index }} {{ forloop.index }} {% endfor %}{% endfor %}

tests.name: parentloop goes out of scope
tests.template: {% for i in (1..2)%}{% for j in (1..2) %}{{ i }} {{ j }} {% endfor %}{{ forloop.parentloop.index }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: parent's parentloop
tests.template: {% for i in (1..2) %}{% for j in (1..2) %}{% for k in (1..2) %}i={{ forloop.parentloop.parentloop.index }} j={{ forloop.parentloop.index }} k={{ forloop.index }} {% endfor %}{% endfor %}{% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over an existing range object
tests.template: {% assign foo = (1..3) %}{{ foo | join: '#' }}{% for i in foo %}{{ i }}{% endfor %}{% for i in foo %}{{ i }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over range with float start
tests.template: {% assign x = (2.4..5) %}{% for i in x %}{{ i }}{% endfor %}

tests.name: share outer scope
tests.template: {% assign foo = 'hello' %}{% for x in (1..3) %}{% assign foo = x %}{% endfor %}{{ foo }}

tests.name: offset and limit
tests.template: {% for tag in tags limit: 3 offset: 1 %}{{ tag }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: first and last with an offset and limit
tests.template: {% for tag in tags limit: 2 offset: 1 %}{{ tag }} {{ forloop.first }} {{ forloop.last }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: garden true false home false true

tests.name: first and last with offset continue
tests.template: {% for tag in product.tags limit: 1 %}{% endfor %}{% for tag in product.tags offset: continue %}{{ forloop.first }} {{ forloop.last }} {% endfor %}
tests.result: true false false false false false false false false true

tests.name: range start and stop are the same
tests.template: {% for i in (1..1) %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: range start and stop are zero
tests.template: {% for i in (0..0) %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: limit is a string
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) limit: '2' %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset is a string
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) offset: '2' %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: limit is a non-number string
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) limit: 'foo' %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset is a non-number string
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) offset: 'foo' %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: limit is not a string or number
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) limit: foo %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: offset is not a string or number
tests.template: {% for i in (1..4) offset: foo %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: comma separated arguments
tests.template: {% for i in (1..6), limit: 4, offset: 2 %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: some comma separated arguments
tests.template: {% for i in (1..6) limit: 4, offset: 2, %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over a string literal
tests.template: {% for i in 'hello' %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}

tests.name: loop over a string variable
tests.template: {% for i in foo %}{{ i }} {% endfor %}
